aircraft.value: Atlas Cargo - AC-2319-424 at Sector East Station

defect_observed.value: Wheel brake assembly seizure. Abnormality observed during system test.

root_cause.value: Contamination ingress through damaged seal assembly

findings.value: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Cargo Handling component. Testing confirmed performance below acceptable limits.

corrective_action.value: Revise maintenance procedure to include additional verification steps

remarks_investigation.value: Investigation completed as per established procedures. All findings documented.

remarks_design.value: Investigation findings reviewed. Root cause analysis is acceptable. Recommend implementation of proposed corrective actions. Date: 23/11/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Dr. A.K. Sharma

remarks_quality.value: Dept. Manufacturing quality documentation reviewed. No deviations noted. Concur with investigation findings. Date: 24/11/2024 Signature: Dr. S.M. Kulkarni

remarks_user.value: (Project):(if applicable) User feedback incorporated. Recommend enhanced crew training on system operation and limitations. Date: 28/11/2024 Signature: Eng. R.P. Singh

remarks_ordaqa.value: (Quality Aspects) Regulatory quality requirements verified. Proposed actions meet airworthiness standards. Recommend approval. Date: 30/11/2024 Signature: Dr. P.L. Mehta

remarks_cemilac.value: / RCMA (Design Aspects) From regulatory standpoint, investigation meets required standards. Approve proposed corrective actions. Date: 28/11/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr H.S. Bhatia

a) Root Cause Analysis: Contamination ingress through damaged seal assembly
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Cargo Handling component. Testing
confirmed performance below acceptable limits.
c) Remedial Measures Revise maintenance procedure to include additional verification steps
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Conduct fleet-wide inspection campaign
d) Attributable Code: F - Failure/ageing/Corrosion/Material Failure
